title: Trying to use `lsjson` with invalid Google Photos credentials says "failed to configure Box"
body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

Trying to use `lsjson` with invalid Google Photos credentials says "failed to configure Box"

#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)

```
rclone v1.70.0-beta.8779.e469c8974                      
- os/version: debian 12.10 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 6.12.25-production+truenas (x86_64)
- os/type: linux
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.24.4
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: none
```

#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (e.g. Windows 7, 64 bit)

debian 12.10 (64 bit)

#### Which cloud storage system are you using? (e.g. Google Drive)

Google Photos

#### The command you were trying to run (e.g. `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
./rclone -vv --config ~/1 lsjson remote:/
```

config file is
```
[remote]
type = googlephotos
client_id = asdf
client_secret = sdaf
token = asdf
```

#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (e.g. output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

```
2025/06/13 03:55:25 DEBUG : rclone: Version "v1.70.0-beta.8779.e469c8974" starting with parameters ["./rclone" "-vv" "--config" "/root/1" "lsjson" "remote:/"]
2025/06/13 03:55:25 DEBUG : Creating backend with remote "remote:/"
2025/06/13 03:55:25 DEBUG : Using config file from "/root/1"
2025/06/13 03:55:25 CRITICAL: Failed to create file system for "remote:/": failed to configure Box: invalid character 'a' looking for beginning of value
```
